summary: The 'Alleviating Barriers for Caregivers Act' (ABC Act) mandates the Administrator of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services and the Commissioner of Social Security to review and simplify processes, procedures, forms, and communications related to Medicare, Medicaid, CHIP, and Social Security programs for family caregivers. The bill aims to reduce administrative burdens, improve communication, and provide better information to caregivers. It requires reports to Congress detailing findings and proposed actions, and encourages similar reviews at the state level to support caregivers.
